image.altText: Lior Sivan army

props.synopsis: Captain Lior Sivan has become the first Australian to be killed while fighting for Israel against Hamas inside Gaza.

title.children: 32-year-old Australian man serving with Israeli army killed inside Gaza

image.altText: A man wearing a blue shirt and beige pants leans against a tree

props.synopsis: Halls Creek Shire in the Kimberley confirms chief executive Phillip Cassell has resigned, but it won't comment on the nature of the allegations raised during a council meeting.

title.children: Outback shire tight-lipped after CEO resigns after 'allegations' raised during closed door session

image.altText: A building with a boab tree in front of it

props.synopsis: Questions remain about how an Indigenous corporation in the Kimberley employed multiple close family members to work in the much-vaunted Target 120 program. Local leaders want the state to take a closer look.

title.children: WA government urged to look into multiple family hires in taxpayer-funded Kimberley youth crime program

image.altText: Drone shot of Denham. On the left is pristine coastal water and one the right the main street of town.

props.synopsis: With limited housing, Shark Bay residents are having to go to all lengths to live in town such as sleeping in boats, caravans, and shipping homes from other parts of the state.

title.children: Shark Bay's lack of housing imperils people trying to make a living in paradise

image.altText: A man is speaking into a microphone with a crowd surrounding him.

props.synopsis: South Korean opposition party leader Lee Jae-myung is stabbed while talking to reporters in the port city of Busan, according to Yonhap news agency.

title.children: South Korean opposition leader stabbed in the neck during press conference

image.altText: David Warner looks to one side surrounded by his teammates

props.synopsis: David Warner has called for the return of his baggy green cap after it went missing ahead of his final Test appearance for Australia.

title.children: Retiring Warner makes public plea for return of missing baggy green cap

image.altText: Rescue crews exit flood waters carrying a boat.

props.synopsis: The threat of heavy rainfall is moving north of the Gold Coast, to Brisbane and Sunshine Coast, giving residents cleaning up from Christmas storms on the Gold Coast some reprieve.

title.children: Threat of rainfall and flash flooding moves north to Brisbane and Sunshine Coast

image.altText: Five people in royal attire pose for a portrait, Queen Margrethe and Prince Frederik are seated at front adorned in jewels

props.synopsis: From a feud over her grandchildren's titles, to a Spanish tabloid's claims of infidelity, the last few years have been dramatic for the Danish monarchy.

title.children: The tumultuous year of family drama and cheating rumours that preceded Queen Margrethe's abdication

image.altText: Insulin testing equipment with a needle to the right and a small electronic device for testing levels left

props.synopsis: Researchers at the Baker Heart and Diabetes Institute say they've discovered a way to pancreatic cells to produce insulin using existing cancer drugs.

title.children: Researchers say diabetes treatment breakthrough could lead to end of insulin injections

image.altText: A collapsed building in the middle of a main road with cars

props.synopsis: The powerful earthquake struck central Japan on Monday, killing at least five people, destroying buildings, knocking out power to tens of thousands of homes, and prompting residents in some areas to flee.

title.children: Nearly 100,000 residents in Japan ordered to evacuate as earthquake leaves people trapped under rubble

image.altText: A police officer unspools crime scene tape with a rive behind him

props.synopsis: WA Police say the families whose children drowned in a New Year's Eve tragedy in Perth's Swan River need to be "allowed to grieve" after suffering devastating trauma.

title.children: Children who drowned in New Year's Eve tragedy knew each other, police say

image.altText: A woman smiles with a medal.

props.synopsis: The death of world champion cyclist Melissa Hoskins and the arrest of her husband Rohan Dennis, who has been charged with dangerous driving offences, send shock waves through Australian sporting circles and the broader cycling world.

title.children: Melissa Hoskins's death has left the cycling world grief-stricken — here's what we know so far

image.altText: A police car and a police motorbike stopped at a T-junction with lights flashing

props.synopsis: The crash happened just before midnight on the Tasman Highway, the main route from Hobart to the east coast. A section of the highway remains closed and a diversion is in place.

title.children: Boy 'lying on the road' struck and killed in Tasmanian highway crash, police say

image.altText: White banner saying "another sold" following house sale

props.synopsis: Sydney remains the most expensive city in the country to buy a property with the average home in Greater Sydney now worth almost $1.13 million.

title.children: Home ownership 'even more out of reach' for many with home prices surging in 2023

image.altText: helicopter flies in front of plumes of smoke coming from Gaza strip

props.synopsis: An Israeli man who never served in the military has been charged with impersonating a soldier and stealing weapons after sneaking into an army unit and joining the fight against Hamas.

title.children: Israeli man indicted for impersonating a soldier as military says it will shift thousands of troops out of Gaza

image.altText: picture of Israeli prime minister Benjamin Netanyahu

props.synopsis: Israel's Supreme Court has struck down a highly disputed law passed by Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's right-wing government that rolled back some of the high court's power and sparked months of nationwide protests.

title.children: Israel's Supreme Court strikes down disputed law that limited court oversight

image.altText: Car drives through floodwater

props.synopsis: The SES warns motorists about flooding dangers after extraordinary footage emerges of a car towing a trailer through floodwater in NSW before bridge is swept away by raging torrent.

title.children: Driver towing trailer through flooded river 'seconds' from disaster as bridge gives way in 530mm NSW deluge

image.altText: 3x3 Widest

props.synopsis: NT Police have launched an investigation after a 19-year-old man was found dead on Undoolya Road on Monday.

title.children: 19-year-old man found dead on remote road near Alice Springs in suspicious circumstances

image.altText: A film still of Michael Fassbender, crouching and screaming, surrounded by a Pacific Islander football team, in green.

props.synopsis: The much-loved Kiwi director returns with a movie based on the true story of the American Samoa soccer team, starring Michael Fassbender.

title.children: Taika Waititi was once a renegade. Does his new movie measure up?

image.altText: Donald Trump points his finger while partially poking his tongue out

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's eligibility to run in 2024 is in question, with courts all over the country weighing in – but so far the latest legal dramas are playing straight into the former president's hands, writes North America correspondent Barbara Miller.

title.children: As Trump's legal woes spiral, can anything keep him from a second tilt at the White House?

image.altText: Ben Shleton plays a double-fisted backhand at the Brisbane International.

props.synopsis: With the Australian Open less than a fortnight away, Ben Shelton's preparations take a hit after going down in the first round of the Brisbane International.

title.children: Rising star Shelton makes shock Brisbane International exit

image.altText: The outside of the County Court of Victoria building.

props.synopsis: Recordings of hearings including witness testimony from highly sensitive cases may have been accessed or stolen from Victoria's court system in an attack discovered in the lead-up to the Christmas break.

title.children: 'YOU HAVE BEEN PWND': Victoria's court system hit by ransomware attack

image.altText: A stylised graphic of the ASX board with an up arrow.

props.synopsis: Key market and currency watchers say the Australian share market is likely to outperform other major financial markets in 2024 and the Australian dollar will trade higher against the greenback, with or without interest rate cuts.

title.children: Australian shares could reach a record high in 2024, but a possible recession threatens that outlook

image.altText: New houses sit on a hillside in a housing estate at Albion Park.

props.synopsis: The ASX is in positive territory on first trading day of 2024, while data shows Australian property prices jumped by 8.1 per cent in 2023.

title.children: House prices jump by 8.1pc in 2023, ASX in positive territory

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Home ownership 'even more out of reach' for many

image.altText: Three guinea pigs look at the camera, one is eating a mouthful of pumpkin.

props.synopsis: They "eat like you wouldn't believe" and don't burrow or climb, but after introducing nearly 140 of the critters to his property in Far North Queensland last year he has lost almost two-thirds to predators.

title.children: John found a solution for farm weeds, but keeping his guinea pig workers safe from predators is a challenge

image.altText: A large painting of a pink and white galah on a yellow background

props.synopsis: Police say a man entered the hospital's cardiology unit and stole a large painting before strapping it to his car and driving away.

title.children: Where's Wally? Search continues for painting allegedly stolen from Adelaide hospital

image.altText: A large blue fish

props.synopsis: Locals were upset after they spotted a man in a wetsuit and snorkel, carrying a speargun and hauling the endangered fish across the rock platform at  Cronulla.

title.children: Outrage over fine for spearing of blue groper at Sydney beach

image.altText: A woman, Loren Hanton, holding a barramundi fish tagged with a season nine million dollar fish tag

props.synopsis: Every wet season, anglers flock to the Northern Territory for the popular Million Dollar Fish competition — and this season it's been guaranteed someone will win the top prize for the first time.

title.children: Loren caught a fish worth $10,000 as part of a popular NT fishing competition. She says the joy 'can't compare'

image.altText: Powerlines down proxy

props.synopsis: This summer is predicted to be Victoria's most dangerous bushfire season in recent years. Some fear power companies haven't done enough to mitigate risk.

title.children: More than half of the most catastrophic Black Saturday bushfires were started by high-voltage powerlines

image.altText: A male lion stalks through grassland, with its mouth open and one of its front paws raised slightly.

props.synopsis: Police in Kenya have recovered the body of a man believed to have been attacked by a lion while he was riding a motorcycle near a national reserve.

title.children: Police in Kenya suspect a man was attacked by a lion while riding a motorcycle

image.altText: Children in a classroom

props.synopsis: Ava Towers stopped attending school, refusing to get out of the car at drop-off. Her father didn't know what to do, until a specialist team reached out to help.

title.children: More and more kids are refusing to go to school, but this specialist school is trying to fix that

image.altText: Leg spin bowler Lloyd Pope standing at the Adelaide Oval

props.synopsis: Lloyd Pope made his first class debut for South Australia in the 2018-19 season and in his second match took 7-87 in an innings against Queensland, becoming the youngest bowler to take a seven wicket haul in the Sheffield Shield.

title.children: Forgotten leg spin bowler still dreams of playing for Australia
